__e: We never made it out of the house that night, did we?
It's not that you weren't there that night.
And I would have given my life, Lawrence, that you hadn't found us that night.
Yeah, Bryan, he's the one who found you hidden in the basement that night.
I've been thinking... I wonder if you could convince him... that everything was just as I said it was that night at the inn.
I tell you that night in the taxi I thought I was lucky just to be alive.
It's not that you weren't there that night.
No, I haven't talked to him since that night, and I don't want to ever, because of what... because of what he did.
Part of me blames myself for what happened that night.
I was in the city with your sister at that time.
Well, at the time, sir, I was more frightened for my husband, for his safety and his sanity.
At that time I was a kid and didn't understand.
In here is the dust of those who went before us, even the First Man and First Woman.
But among them, unhappily, came the names of those who were gone forever.
You will consider him your husband now in all manner except that which leads to family.
He who speaks does not know.
Some day, you know, he who is your father may forget you.
